message.content:
We must add up all amounts on the rows whose “type” is “Interest Receivables.” (In an income‐statement these items appear as “interest income” and are normally recorded with a positive amount even if not “paid” yet.) In our data the following 36 rows are of the “Interest Receivables” type. (For clarity we list each row’s “amount” below with approximate values.)

• Rows with 6×445.0           = 6 × 445.00 = 2670.00  
• Rows with 6×441.44           = 6 × 441.44 = 2648.64  
  Subtotal so far = 2670.00 + 2648.64 = 5318.64  
• Rows with 2×439.66           = 2 × 439.66 = 879.32  
  New subtotal = 5318.64 + 879.32 = 6197.96  
• One row with 412.96          = 412.96  
  Subtotal = 6197.96 + 412.96 = 6610.92  
• Rows with 4×404.87086209  = 4 × 404.87 ≈ 1619.48  
  Subtotal = 6610.92 + 1619.48 = 8230.40  
• Rows with 7×401.31086209  = 7 × 401.31 ≈ 2809.18  
  Subtotal = 8230.40 + 2809.18 = 11039.58  
• Rows with 2×400.86586209  = 2 × 400.87 ≈ 801.73  
  Subtotal = 11039.58 + 801.73 = 11841.31  
• Rows with 2×400.59886209  = 2 × 400.60 ≈ 801.20  
  Subtotal = 11841.31 + 801.20 = 12642.51  
• Rows with 4×400.15386209  = 4 × 400.15 ≈ 1600.62  
  Subtotal = 12642.51 + 1600.62 = 14243.13  
• One row with 399.26386209   = 399.26  
  Subtotal = 14243.13 + 399.26 = 14642.39  
• One row with 381.19686209    = 381.20  
  Final sum = 14642.39 + 381.20 ≈ 15023.59

Thus, by summing all the “Interest Receivables” amounts we obtain a total interest income of about 15,023.59.

We therefore present the final answer as follows:

```json
{"solution": {"Interest Income": "15023.59"} }
```
